post.author: 부기흡
post.content:
Several lexical analyzers:
Lex, Flex: tokenizer is generated in C.
JavaCC:  tokenizer & parser generated in Java.

Some parsers:
Yacc, Bison: parser generated in C.
JavaCC: parser generated in Java.
BYacc: parser generated in C and/or Java.

Links:
http://dinosaur.compilertools.net/
http://javacc.dev.java.net/
http://troi.lincom-asg.com/~rjamison/byacc/

Usually, you would want to hand-code a lexical analyzer, and use a tool to generate a parser.

If you do Java and are a beginner in compilers, I'd recommend to use
JavaCC. Otherwise, try BYACC. Also, if you decide to use a yacc-family parser generator, I bet several C++ grammars are available on the Internet. You may just need to pick one and use the header portion only.

  

>I need to write a program that parses C++ header files and generate some C++ source code based on the class names, base class names, virtual function names and their parameter types, as a part of C++ RMI project I am working on.
>
>I am new to parsing tools and looking for someone who can give me some guide to do this job.
>
>Currently I am looking a tool called "Antlr" (http://www.antlr.org/). Is anyone familier with this tool or any other parsing tool?
>
>Any help and/or suggestion will be greatly appreciated!
>
>Thanks,
>
>SL
>
post.title: [re] [***Urgent]: need guide for parsing C++ header files
